articles.author: Johann Cherian, Shristi A
articles.description: Wall Street advanced on Thursday after recovering from a broad sell-off in the prior session, with latest data adding to expectations that borrowing costs could ease next year, while chipmaker Micron advanced after giving an upbeat forecast.
articles.title: Wall St rises after broad sell-off; Micron shines

articles.author: Siyi Liu, Dominique Patton
articles.description: China, the world's top processor of rare earths, on Thursday banned the export of technology to extract and separate the strategic metals, in a further step towards protecting its dominance in several strategic metals.
articles.title: China bans export of rare earth processing tech over national security

articles.author: Rajesh Singh, Allison Lampert
articles.description: The compensation system for flight attendants in the U.S. and Canada is under attack in new contract negotiations that could lead to big pay raises for cabin crews, but higher costs for airlines.
articles.title: Flight attendants in North America push for landmark changes in new contracts

articles.author: Gleb Stolyarov
articles.description: Russia has handed out more than $12 billion in state subsidies and loans to keep its aviation sector afloat since Western sanctions over Moscow's invasion of Ukraine cut off supplies of key parts and maintenance services, a Reuters analysis shows.
articles.title: Russia splashes $12 bln to keep aviation sector in the air

articles.author: Miguel Gomes, Ahmad Ghaddar, Alex Lawler
articles.description: Angola said on Thursday it would leave OPEC in a blow to the Saudi-led oil producer group that has sought in recent months to rally support for further output cuts to prop up oil prices.
articles.title: Angola leaves OPEC in blow to oil producer group

articles.author: Ron Bousso, Vera Eckert, Yadarisa Shabong
articles.description: Britain's Harbour Energy on Thursday agreed to acquire Wintershall Dea's non-Russian oil and gas assets in a $11.2 billion share and cash deal with co-owners BASF and LetterOne that creates one of the world's biggest independent producers.
articles.title: Britain's Harbour Energy strikes $11.2 billion deal for Wintershall Dea assets

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A gunman killed 10 people and seriously wounded 11 others at a Prague university on Thursday before being "eliminated", according to police and Prague emergency services.
articles.title: Gunman kills 10 people in Prague university shooting

articles.author: Drazen Jorgic, Jackie Botts
articles.description: Mexico's army appears to be raiding only a handful of active drug labs every month, despite U.S. pressure to crack down on fentanyl trafficking, with facilities that were already out of use accounting for 95% of seizures this year, according to defense ministry figures obtained by Reuters.
articles.title: Under US pressure over fentanyl, Mexico wages “imaginary war on drugs”

articles.author: Norihiko Shirouzu, Paul Lienert
articles.description: Elon Musk says prototypes are easy, production is hell. And when it comes to the long-awaited Cybertruck, Tesla's hell is its pioneering 4680 battery.
articles.title: Tesla Cybertruck deliveries hostage to battery production hell

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Trump ally Rudy Giuliani filed for bankruptcy on Thursday, days after a jury decided he must pay more than $148 million in damages to two former Georgia election workers he defamed by falsely accusing them of helping to rig the 2020 election.
articles.title: Giuliani seeks bankruptcy after $148 mln judgment in defamation case -filing
